title: [Docs]: Confusion about To type for Link and NavigateFunction
body:
### Describe what's incorrect/missing in the documentation

I had assumed that the function returned by `useNavigate` and the `Link` component accepted the same type for the `to` argument/prop.  At some point between version 6.2.1 and 6.9.0, both accepted a [URL object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/URL/URL).  I found this convenient and assumed it was meant to be this way.

I just upgraded to `react-router-dom@6.9.0` and was surprised to see that none of my `Link` components worked where I was passing a URL object as the `to` prop.  So I updated all the places this was happening to return a `url.toString()` version of that URL instead.  Then I was surprised to see that my `navigate` calls didn't work.

My URL objects previously had an origin, but `navigate` calls didn't try to concatenate that in the path.  For example, previously calling `navigate(url)` where `url.origin` was `https://example.com` didn't try to navigate to `https://example.com/https://example.com/some/path`.  Now, when I call `navigate(url.toString())` with that same URL object, I do see navigation to the unexpected path (`https://example.com/https://example.com/some/path`).

I see that the [`useNavigate` docs](https://reactrouter.com/en/main/hooks/use-navigate) say that the `To` value is "the same type as `<Link to>`".  And then the [type declaration for `Link`](https://reactrouter.com/en/main/components/link) shows that the `To` type is `string | Partial<Path>`.  So this probably isn't really a doc issue and just user error.  But to be honest I don't know what a `Partial<Path>` is and maybe I read that and wrongly assumed that a `URL` object would work (and when it did I was happy).

Maybe there is nothing to be done here, and I understand if this just gets closed.  If anything, maybe the docs could clarify what a `Partial<Path>` is (or say that a `URL` object cannot be used).

Thanks for your work on react-router and the nice docs.
